snippet: As the president speaks out on Eric Garner and Michael Brown, his shifting roles come through clearly.
abstract: Brent Staples Editorial Observer submits that killings of Michael Brown and Eric Garner by police officers has prompted Pres Obama to take more defined stand on race relations; holds that Obama has had to assume roles of president, African-American man and former community organizer as he addresses deaths and accompanying protests; remarks that his effort to balance shifting roles is evident in interview he gave on BET Networks.
lead_paragraph: As the president speaks out on Eric Garner and Michael Brown, his shifting roles come through clearly.

headline.print_headline: Mr. Obama Considers the Nationwide Protests From Three Points of View
headline.main: Mr. Obama Considers the Nationwide Protests From Three Points of View
